import Mathlib

/-!
Exercise: Show that the lower limit topology ‚Ñù_l and K-topology ‚Ñù_K are not comparable.
We write two topologies on ‚Ñù: the lower limit (or Sorgenfrey) topology generated by
basis {[a,b) | a<b}, and the K-topology which has basis all open intervals (a,b)
and sets of the form (a,b) \ K where K = {1/n | n ‚àà ‚Ñï, n > 0}.

We assert that neither topology is finer than the other.
-/

  ¬¨ (lower_limit_topology ‚Ñù ‚â§ K_topology ‚Ñù) ‚àß ¬¨ (K_topology ‚Ñù ‚â§ lower_limit_topology ‚Ñù) := by sorry
